# mscrm-addons.com

## Overview

- **Website:** https://www.mscrm-addons.com/
- **Category:** Microsoft Dynamics 365 & Power Platform Add-Ons
- **Description:** A trusted, long-standing Microsoft Partner specializing in certified and customizable add-ons for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. Their solutions focus on document automation, storage capacity management, and workflow optimization.

## Contact Information

- **Support Email:** support@mscrm-addons.com
- **Sales Email:** sales@mscrm-addons.com
- **Phone (US):** +1 404 720 6066
- **Phone (EU):** +43 316 680 880
- **Support Hours:** 17/5 (17 hours, 5 days)

## Company Details

- **Status:** Active, Operating
- **Type:** For Profit
- **Customer Base:** 5,500+ satisfied customers worldwide
- **Daily Users:** 80,000+
- **Partner Network:** 700+ partners
- **Geographic Reach:** 80+ countries

## Core Products

1. **DocumentsCorePack** - Professional document automation for Dynamics 365, Power Automate, Power Apps, Power Pages, and Copilot
2. **AttachmentExtractor** - Email attachment and notes management solution that moves attachments from Dataverse to cost-effective external storage
3. **ActivityTools** - Additional productivity tools for Dynamics 365

## Key Differentiators

- Microsoft-certified solutions
- No-code document automation
- Significant storage cost reduction (customers report 90%+ savings)
- Seamless integration across Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
- Customizable templates and workflows
- Maintains unchanged user experience while optimizing backend storage

## Pricing & Plans

### DocumentsCorePack - Subscription (Online) Pricing

All subscription prices are all-inclusive covering self-deployment, secure hosting, support, and maintenance with no additional costs.

| Tier | User Limit | Annual Price | Monthly Price | Template Designers | Sandboxes | Documents/Month | Free Trial |
|------|------------|--------------|---------------|-------------------|-----------|-----------------|------------|
| **Extra Small** | Up to 10 users | €800/year | €80/month | 1 | 1 | 500 | 14 days |
| **Small** | Up to 30 users | €1,300/year | €130/month | 1 | 1 | 1,000 | 14 days |
| **Medium** | Up to 80 users | €1,950/year | €195/month | 2 | 2 | 5,000 | 14 days |
| **Large** | Up to 140 users | €2,600/year | €260/month | 2 | 2 | 10,000 | 14 days |
| **Extra Large** | Up to 300 users | €5,400/year | €540/month | 5 | 3 | 25,000 | 14 days |
| **XXL** | Up to 600 users | €9,800/year | €980/month | 10 | 5 | 50,000 | 14 days |
| **Enterprise** | 600+ users | Contact Sales | Contact Sales | Custom | Custom | Custom | 14 days |

**Licensing Note:** Every user with a security role that grants write permission to a table in Dynamics 365 requires a license.

### DocumentsCorePack - Perpetual (On-Premise) Pricing

One-time purchase with Year 1 Support & Maintenance included:

| Tier | User Limit | Perpetual Price | Notes |
|------|------------|-----------------|-------|
| **Extra Small** | 1-10 users | €660 | One license per organization |
| **Small** | 11-30 users | €1,200 | One license per organization |
| **Medium** | 31-80 users | €3,000 | One license per organization (Best Value) |
| **Large** | 81-140 users | €5,000 | One license per organization |
| **Extra Large** | 141-300 users | €10,000 | One license per organization |
| **XXL** | 301-600 users | €19,000 | One license per organization |
| **Enterprise** | 600+ users | Contact Sales | One license per organization |

**Add-Ons:**
- **Additional Template Designer:** €120 per user (Year 1 Support & Maintenance included)

### AttachmentExtractor Pricing

Pricing available upon request - contact sales@mscrm-addons.com

### Free Trial

- **Duration:** 14 days
- **Features:** Full access to all features and support
- **Payment:** No payment required during trial

## Features

### DocumentsCorePack - Core Capabilities

1. **Professional Document Generation**
   - Create documents from Dynamics 365 data
   - Microsoft Word-based templates
   - Server-based and/or Client-based document generation
   - No-code template design

2. **Multi-Platform Integration**
   - Dynamics 365 (all Customer Engagement modules)
   - Power Automate (Flow) connector for full automation
   - Power Apps integration
   - Power Pages document generation
   - Microsoft Copilot integration for AI-driven processing

3. **Document Automation**
   - Automated document creation workflows
   - Batch document generation
   - Template versioning and management
   - Document delivery automation

4. **Template Design Tools**
   - Drag-and-drop template builder
   - Field mapping from Dynamics 365
   - Conditional content and formatting
   - Multi-language support
   - Custom branding

5. **Advanced Processing**
   - Electronic signature support
   - PDF generation
   - Merge documents
   - Document conversion
   - Complex document requirements handling

### AttachmentExtractor - Core Capabilities

1. **Storage Optimization**
   - Automatically moves email attachments from Dataverse to external storage
   - Moves note attachments to external storage
   - Reduces Dynamics 365 capacity costs by 90%+
   - No impact on user experience

2. **Storage Destination Options**
   - SharePoint integration
   - Azure Blob Storage
   - On-premise file storage

3. **Smart Extraction**
   - Automatic extraction rules
   - Configurable extraction policies
   - Activity party cleanup
   - Email content extraction modes

4. **User Experience**
   - Unchanged UX - users access attachments as before
   - Transparent file retrieval
   - Preview functionality maintained
   - No additional clicks or complexity

### ActivityTools - Core Capabilities

1. **Activity Management**
   - Enhanced activity overview in Dynamics 365
   - Improved email handling
   - Preview pane for activities and attachments
   - Simplified activity processes

### Advanced Features (Subscription Tiers)

- **Template Designers:** 1-10 depending on tier (build and edit templates)
- **Sandbox Environments:** 1-5 depending on tier (test environments)
- **Document Generation Limits:** 500-50,000+ documents/month by tier
- **Secure Hosting:** Included in all subscription plans
- **Support & Maintenance:** All-inclusive in subscription; Year 1 included with perpetual

### Enterprise-Only Features

- Custom user limits (600+)
- Custom document generation limits
- Custom template designer allocation
- Custom sandbox environments
- Dedicated support options
- Volume pricing

### Limitations

- **Licensing Model:** Requires license for every active user with write permissions (Subscription model)
- **Per-Organization Licensing:** Perpetual licenses are per organization, not transferable
- **Support Dependency:** Perpetual licenses require annual Support & Maintenance renewal after Year 1
- **User Role Requirements:** Users must have appropriate Dynamics 365 security roles
- **Storage Extraction:** AttachmentExtractor requires external storage setup (SharePoint/Azure)
- **Document Limits:** Monthly document generation caps in subscription tiers (can be increased)

## Technical Requirements

### System Requirements

- **Dynamics 365:** Customer Engagement modules (Sales, Service, Marketing, Field Service, etc.)
- **Power Platform:** Power Automate, Power Apps, Power Pages
- **Office:** Microsoft Word 2013 or later (for DocumentsCorePack client)
- **OS:** Windows-based for client installation
- **SharePoint:** 2013 or higher for AttachmentExtractor (if using SharePoint)

### Integration Support

- REST API endpoint communication
- Native Dynamics 365 integration
- Power Platform connectors
- Azure authentication
- SharePoint compatibility

## Add-On Products & Services

### 1. DocumentsCorePack (Primary Product)

**What it does:**  
Professional document generation and automation for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. Creates Word-based documents from CRM data with no-code template design.

**Key Features:**
- Server-based and client-based document generation
- Power Automate connector for full workflow automation
- Template designer with drag-and-drop functionality
- Electronic signature support
- PDF generation and document merging
- Multi-language and custom branding support
- Microsoft Copilot integration

**Pricing:**  
€800-€9,800/year (subscription) or €660-€19,000 (perpetual license) depending on user count and document volume

**Use Cases:**
- Contract generation from opportunity data
- Automated proposal creation
- Invoice and quote generation
- Compliance document automation
- Customer correspondence templates
- Marketing collateral personalization

### 2. AttachmentExtractor

**What it does:**  
Automatically moves email and note attachments from Dataverse to external storage (SharePoint, Azure Blob, on-premise) to dramatically reduce storage costs.

**Key Features:**
- Automatic extraction from emails and notes
- Transparent file retrieval (unchanged user experience)
- 90%+ storage cost reduction
- Configurable extraction rules and policies
- Support for SharePoint, Azure Blob Storage, on-premise storage
- Activity party cleanup

**Pricing:**  
Contact sales for custom quote

**Use Cases:**
- Organizations hitting Dataverse storage limits
- Companies with large email attachment volumes
- Reducing Microsoft 365 capacity costs
- Compliance archiving to external systems
- Long-term document retention strategies

### 3. ActivityTools

**What it does:**  
Enhances activity and email management in Dynamics 365 with improved views, preview panes, and workflow optimization.

**Key Features:**
- Enhanced activity overview interface
- Email preview pane
- Attachment preview functionality
- Simplified activity handling
- Improved productivity for sales/service teams

**Pricing:**  
Bundled with DocumentsCorePack or available standalone (pricing upon request)

**Use Cases:**
- Sales teams managing high email volumes
- Customer service managing case communications
- Improving email-to-activity tracking
- Streamlining communication workflows

### 4. PowerSearch

**What it does:**  
Enhanced search functionality combining Advanced Find power with simple search usability. Search across multiple fields, entities, and related records.

**Key Features:**
- Multi-field search capabilities
- Saved query lists for frequent searches
- AND/OR query support
- Result preview without opening records
- Customizable grid views
- Bulk-edit and export from search results
- Integration with Power Apps

**Pricing:**  
Available via AppSource (14-day free trial)

**Use Cases:**
- Finding records across multiple related entities
- Creating reusable search templates
- Complex data queries without IT help
- Bulk operations on search results
- Power user productivity enhancement

### 5. SmartBar

**What it does:**  
Customizable navigation toolbar for Dynamics 365 forms providing quick access to related records and common processes.

**Key Features:**
- Color-coded buttons for visual alerts
- Shows count of related records per entity
- Configurable views (e.g., "Open Cases", "Overdue Invoices")
- Hides buttons with zero related records
- Compatible with standard and custom tables
- Integration with model-driven Power Apps

**Pricing:**  
Available via AppSource (14-day free trial)

**Use Cases:**
- Improving user navigation efficiency
- Reducing clicks to access related records
- Visual alerts for critical thresholds
- Customizing user experience per role
- Simplifying complex record relationships

### 6. TelephoneIntegration (DEPRECATED)

**Status:** No longer available for purchase; existing customer support only

**What it did:**  
Computer-telephony integration (CTI) connecting phone systems with Dynamics 365 for caller recognition, click-to-dial, power dialing, and automatic activity creation.

**Note:** mscrm-addons has officially deprecated this product but continues to support existing customers. Organizations seeking CTI solutions should explore alternative providers.


## Integration Overview

mscrm-addons.com provides deep integration capabilities across the Microsoft ecosystem and select third-party services. The company's solutions are built specifically for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, with native connectors and extensive automation capabilities.

**Total Integration Categories:** 7 major categories (Microsoft Platform, Storage, E-Signature, Printing, Workflow Automation, Development, External Data)

### Integration Architecture

- **Native Microsoft Integrations:** REST API communication with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform services
- **Certified Connectors:** Microsoft-verified Power Platform connectors
- **Third-Party Integrations:** Direct API integrations with Adobe Sign, cloud print providers
- **Storage Integrations:** Azure Blob Storage, SharePoint, on-premise file systems
- **Authentication:** Azure AD, OAuth 2.0, API key-based authentication

## Key Integrations

### 1. Microsoft Dynamics 365 (All Customer Engagement Modules)

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Core platform integration enabling document generation, attachment management, and activity tracking across all Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement applications.

**Data Synced:**
- Entity records (Accounts, Contacts, Leads, Opportunities, Cases, etc.)
- Custom entities and fields
- Notes and attachments
- Email activities
- Template associations
- User security roles and permissions

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
DocumentsCorePack requires service configuration with Dynamics 365 connection profile, including:
- Azure Application User setup for authentication
- Security role assignment for users
- Solution deployment to Dynamics 365 environment
- API key generation for connector access

**Modules Supported:**
- Dynamics 365 Sales
- Dynamics 365 Customer Service
- Dynamics 365 Marketing
- Dynamics 365 Field Service
- Dynamics 365 Project Service Automation
- Custom Dynamics 365 applications

**Limitations:**
- Requires licensed DocumentsCorePack service (14-day free trial available)
- Per-user licensing model for subscription deployments
- On-premise deployments require separate perpetual licenses

**Documentation:** [https://www.mscrm-addons.com/Products/DocumentsCorePack](https://www.mscrm-addons.com/Products/DocumentsCorePack)

---

### 2. Microsoft Power Automate

**Type:** Certified Connector (Premium)  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Provides 25+ actions for full document automation within Power Automate workflows, enabling no-code document generation, processing, and delivery workflows.

**Data Synced:**
- Document generation requests
- Template selections
- Document content (base64 encoded)
- DocumentJob status and results
- Print job configurations
- E-signature requests
- SharePoint folder creation requests

**Setup Complexity:** Easy  
Requires API key from DocumentsCorePack service configuration. Connector is pre-certified and available in all Power Automate environments.

**Key Actions Available (25+ total):**
- **Document Generation:**  
  - Create document (sync/async)
  - Create DocumentJob (async)
  - Create Multipart document (sync/async)
  - Get document templates

- **Document Processing:**  
  - Concatenate two DocumentJobs
  - Concatenate two documents (PDF, DOCX)
  - Print DocumentJob
  - Print file
  - Sign DocumentJob (e-signature)

- **Attachment & Delivery:**  
  - Attach DocumentJob to email
  - Attach DocumentJob as note
  - Attach file to email
  - Attach file as note
  - Send email (Dataverse)

- **SharePoint:**  
  - Create SharePoint folder
  - Save to integrated SharePoint

- **Batch Processing:**  
  - Process batch in customer journey (sync/async)

- **Support Actions:**  
  - Get DocumentJob result
  - Get DocumentJob status
  - Get One-Click-Actions
  - Get Printers
  - Who am I (API key info)

**Limitations:**
- Premium connector (requires Power Automate Premium license)
- API rate limit: 1200 calls per connection per 60 seconds
- Requires DocumentsCorePack service subscription or perpetual license
- Not available in China Cloud operated by 21Vianet

**Documentation:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/)

---

### 3. Microsoft Power Apps

**Type:** Certified Connector (Premium)  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Enables canvas apps and model-driven apps to generate and process documents directly from Power Apps interfaces using the same connector actions available in Power Automate.

**Data Synced:**
- Document generation requests from app interfaces
- Template selections via app dropdowns
- User input via prompts
- Document content returned to apps
- Printer selections
- One-Click-Action triggers

**Setup Complexity:** Easy  
Uses the same DocumentsCorePack connector as Power Automate. Requires API key configuration and Premium Power Apps license.

**Use Cases:**
- Custom document generation apps for sales teams
- Self-service portals for document creation
- Mobile document generation on field devices
- Approval workflows with document attachments
- Client-facing document request forms

**Limitations:**
- Premium connector (requires Power Apps Premium license)
- Shares API rate limits with Power Automate (1200 calls/60 sec per connection)
- Not available in China Cloud

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/the-documentscorepack-connector-for-microsoft-flow-and-powerapps/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/the-documentscorepack-connector-for-microsoft-flow-and-powerapps/)

---

### 4. Microsoft Power Pages

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** One-way (Power Pages → DocumentsCorePack)  
**What it does:** Allows external-facing Power Pages portals to generate documents directly from web forms and portal interactions.

**Data Synced:**
- Portal form submissions
- Dataverse records created via portals
- User input from portal pages
- Generated documents returned to portal users

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires Power Pages portal configuration, DocumentsCorePack connector setup, and portal-to-Dataverse authentication.

**Use Cases:**
- Customer self-service document generation (quotes, applications, certificates)
- Partner portals with custom document creation
- Public-facing forms generating personalized documents
- Onboarding workflows with automated document delivery

**Limitations:**
- Requires authenticated portal users for most scenarios
- Portal API limits apply
- Document generation happens server-side (not instant for large documents)

**Documentation:** [https://www.mscrm-addons.com/](https://www.mscrm-addons.com/) (Power Pages integration mentioned on main site)

---

### 5. Microsoft Copilot

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Adds AI-driven document processing to Copilot workflows in Dynamics 365, enabling natural language document generation requests and intelligent template suggestions.

**Data Synced:**
- Copilot user prompts
- Template recommendations
- Document generation triggers
- AI-processed document content

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires Dynamics 365 Copilot license, DocumentsCorePack service, and Copilot configuration for document automation scenarios.

**Use Cases:**
- "Generate a proposal for this opportunity" (natural language command)
- AI-suggested templates based on context
- Automated document workflows triggered by Copilot insights
- Intelligent document field population

**Limitations:**
- Requires Dynamics 365 Copilot license (additional cost)
- Copilot features depend on Microsoft availability in region
- AI suggestions require training data and template library

**Documentation:** [https://www.mscrm-addons.com/](https://www.mscrm-addons.com/) (Copilot integration mentioned on main site)

---

### 6. Microsoft Dataverse

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Direct integration with Dataverse for reading entity data, storing generated documents as notes, and managing attachments. AttachmentExtractor moves attachments from Dataverse to external storage to reduce capacity costs.

**Data Synced:**
- Entity records and custom tables
- Notes (annotations)
- Email attachments
- File attachments
- Activity records
- Security roles and permissions
- Document metadata

**Setup Complexity:** Easy  
Automatic integration when DocumentsCorePack service is configured for a Dynamics 365/Dataverse environment.

**Key Capabilities:**
- **DocumentsCorePack:** Reads Dataverse records, writes generated documents as notes
- **AttachmentExtractor:** Moves email attachments and notes from Dataverse to external storage (SharePoint, Azure Blob, on-premise)
- **Unchanged UX:** Users access attachments transparently (no impact on user experience)

**Limitations:**
- Dataverse API limits apply
- AttachmentExtractor requires external storage configuration
- Extracted attachments stored externally (not in Dataverse)

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/mscrm-addons-com-application-user-for-dynamics-365-app-access/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/mscrm-addons-com-application-user-for-dynamics-365-app-access/)

---

### 7. Microsoft SharePoint (2013 or Higher)

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Stores generated documents directly to SharePoint document libraries, enables AttachmentExtractor to move Dataverse attachments to SharePoint, and supports template backups to SharePoint locations.

**Data Synced:**
- Generated documents (PDF, DOCX, etc.)
- Email attachments extracted from Dataverse
- Note attachments extracted from Dataverse
- Template backup files
- Folder structures

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires SharePoint connection configuration in DocumentsCorePack service, including:
- SharePoint site URL
- Authentication credentials (Azure AD or SharePoint credentials)
- Document library permissions
- Integrated SharePoint configuration (if using Dynamics 365 integrated SharePoint)

**Key Features:**
- **Integrated SharePoint:** Uses Dynamics 365's native SharePoint integration for seamless document storage
- **Custom SharePoint Locations:** Save documents to any SharePoint site/library
- **Folder Creation:** Automated folder structure creation via Power Automate connector
- **SharePoint Compatibility Connection:** Improved performance with SharePoint 2013+ via native REST endpoints
- **Template Backups:** Scheduled backups of DocumentsCorePack templates to SharePoint

**Limitations:**
- Requires SharePoint 2013 or higher
- SharePoint API rate limits apply
- Folder path length maximum: 260 characters
- Cannot mix SharePoint and on-premise storage for same environment

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/how-to-save-a-document-to-sharepoint-with-documentscorepack/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/how-to-save-a-document-to-sharepoint-with-documentscorepack/)

---

### 8. Azure Blob Storage

**Type:** API Integration  
**Direction:** One-way (mscrm-addons → Azure Blob)  
**What it does:** Stores extracted email/note attachments and provides template backup storage to Azure Blob Storage containers.

**Data Synced:**
- Email attachments from Dataverse
- Note attachments from Dataverse
- DocumentsCorePack template backups
- Document files (if configured as alternative storage)

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires:
- Azure subscription and Blob Storage account
- SAS URL (Shared Access Signature) for storage container
- Container creation and permissions configuration
- AttachmentExtractor setup with Azure Blob destination

**Key Features:**
- **Cost-Effective Storage:** Dramatically cheaper than Dataverse capacity (90%+ savings reported)
- **Template Backups:** Scheduled automatic backups of templates to Azure Blob
- **Scalable:** No storage limits (pay-as-you-go Azure pricing)
- **Configurable Retention:** Set custom retention policies in Azure

**Limitations:**
- Requires Azure subscription (additional cost)
- Files stored externally (not in Dynamics 365)
- Requires network connectivity to Azure
- SAS URL expiration requires periodic renewal

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/documentation/gettingstarted/online-service-configuration/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/documentation/gettingstarted/online-service-configuration/) (Cloud Backup section)

---

### 9. Adobe Sign

**Type:** Third-Party Integration (Native Dynamics 365 Integration)  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** DocumentsCorePack leverages Adobe Sign's native Dynamics 365 integration to send generated documents for electronic signature, track signature status, and return signed documents to Dynamics 365.

**Data Synced:**
- Generated documents sent for signature
- Adobe Sign agreement records
- Signature status updates
- Signed document files
- Signer information
- Adobe Sign text tags in templates

**Setup Complexity:** Hard  
Requires:
- Adobe Sign enterprise-level account with Dynamics 365 integration support
- Adobe Sign package installation (via AppSource or on-premise)
- Adobe Sign security role assignment in Dynamics 365
- DocumentsCorePack templates with Adobe Sign text tags
- Agreement entity configuration

**Key Features:**
- **Text Tag Support:** Embed Adobe Sign signature/initial fields directly in DocumentsCorePack Word templates
- **Automated Workflows:** Power Automate connector action: "Sign DocumentJob"
- **Multi-Signee Support:** Send documents to multiple signers with custom workflows
- **Agreement Tracking:** Full Adobe Sign agreement history in Dynamics 365

**Adobe Sign Security Roles:**
- **Adobe Sign Reader:** Read-only access to agreement records
- **Adobe Sign User:** User-level access (own records only)
- **Adobe Sign Administrator:** Full access including global settings and data migration

**Limitations:**
- Requires enterprise-level Adobe Sign license (expensive)
- Adobe Sign Dynamics 365 integration must be separately licensed
- Text tag syntax must be manually coded in templates
- Not all Adobe Sign features available via Dynamics integration

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/get-started-with-adobe-sign-for-microsoft-dynamics-365-installationconfiguration/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/get-started-with-adobe-sign-for-microsoft-dynamics-365-installationconfiguration/)

---

### 10. Azure Logic Apps

**Type:** Certified Connector (Standard)  
**Direction:** Bi-directional  
**What it does:** Provides the same DocumentsCorePack connector actions available in Power Automate, enabling document automation in Azure Logic Apps workflows for enterprise integration scenarios.

**Data Synced:**
- Same as Power Automate connector (25+ actions)
- Document generation requests
- Document content
- Status and result data

**Setup Complexity:** Easy  
Uses the same DocumentsCorePack API connector as Power Automate. Requires API key and Azure Logic Apps subscription.

**Use Cases:**
- Enterprise B2B document automation
- Integration with non-Microsoft systems via Logic Apps connectors
- Serverless document processing workflows
- Event-driven document generation (e.g., from Azure Service Bus, Event Grid)

**Limitations:**
- Standard connector tier in Logic Apps (consumption-based pricing)
- Not available in Azure China regions
- Same API rate limits as Power Automate (1200 calls/60 sec)

**Documentation:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/)

---

### 11. Cloud Print Providers (3 Major Providers - Specific Names Not Publicly Disclosed)

**Type:** Third-Party API Integration  
**Direction:** One-way (mscrm-addons → Print Providers)  
**What it does:** Integrates with three major cloud printing services to enable document printing from Dynamics 365, Power Automate, and Power Apps without requiring local printer drivers or infrastructure.

**Data Synced:**
- Document files (PDF, DOCX)
- Print job configurations (copies, printer selection)
- Print job status
- Printer availability

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires:
- Account with supported cloud print provider
- Cloud printer configuration in DocumentsCorePack service
- Printer assignment to Dynamics 365 users
- Network connectivity to cloud print API

**Key Features:**
- **Power Automate Actions:** "Print DocumentJob" and "Print file" actions in connector
- **User-Specific Printers:** Assign printers to individual users or teams
- **Print Copies:** Configure multiple copies per print job
- **Cross-Platform:** Print from anywhere (no VPN required for cloud printers)

**Limitations:**
- Cannot mix cloud print provider and local printers for same Dynamics 365 organization
- Specific cloud print provider names not publicly documented (requires sales contact)
- Cloud print provider subscription costs apply separately
- Requires internet connectivity for printing

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/printing-with-documentscorepack/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/printing-with-documentscorepack/)

---

### 12. Local Printers (On-Premise Printing)

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** One-way (mscrm-addons → Local Printers)  
**What it does:** Enables printing to local network printers directly from Dynamics 365 and Power Automate workflows using DocumentsCorePack's on-premise printing infrastructure.

**Data Synced:**
- Document files (PDF, DOCX)
- Print job configurations
- Printer queue status

**Setup Complexity:** Medium  
Requires:
- DocumentsCorePack on-premise service deployment
- Network printer configuration
- Printer driver installation on DocumentsCorePack service server
- Firewall/network access configuration

**Key Features:**
- **Direct Printer Access:** Print to local network printers without cloud intermediary
- **Cost Savings:** No cloud print provider subscription required
- **Low Latency:** Faster printing for high-volume scenarios

**Limitations:**
- Requires on-premise DocumentsCorePack service deployment (not available in cloud-only subscriptions)
- Cannot mix local printers with cloud print providers for same organization
- Network infrastructure required (VPN for remote users)
- Printer drivers must be installed on service server

**Documentation:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/printing-with-documentscorepack/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/knowledgebase/printing-with-documentscorepack/)

---

### 13. On-Premise File Storage

**Type:** Native Integration  
**Direction:** One-way (Dataverse → On-Premise Storage)  
**What it does:** AttachmentExtractor can move email and note attachments from Dataverse to on-premise file systems (network shares, local servers) to reduce Dataverse capacity costs.

**Data Synced:**
- Email attachments from Dataverse
- Note attachments from Dataverse
- File metadata

**Setup Complexity:** Hard  
Requires:
- On-premise file server or network share
- DocumentsCorePack on-premise service deployment
- File server permissions configuration
- Network connectivity between Dynamics 365 and file server (VPN if cloud Dynamics 365)

**Key Features:**
- **Full Control:** Complete control over file storage location and retention
- **Cost Savings:** No Azure/SharePoint storage costs
- **Compliance:** Keep files on-premise for regulatory requirements
- **Transparent UX:** Users access attachments as if still in Dataverse

**Limitations:**
- Requires on-premise DocumentsCorePack deployment
- Network infrastructure complexity (especially for cloud Dynamics 365)
- File server backup and maintenance responsibility
- Latency for cloud Dynamics 365 users accessing on-premise files

**Documentation:** [https://www.mscrm-addons.com/Products/AttachmentExtractor](https://www.mscrm-addons.com/Products/AttachmentExtractor)

---

## Integration Categories

### Microsoft Platform (6 integrations)
- Dynamics 365 (all Customer Engagement modules)
- Power Automate (25+ actions)
- Power Apps
- Power Pages
- Copilot
- Dataverse

### Storage & File Management (3 integrations)
- SharePoint (2013+)
- Azure Blob Storage
- On-premise file storage

### E-Signature (1 integration)
- Adobe Sign (via native Dynamics 365 integration)

### Printing (2 integrations)
- Cloud Print Providers (3 major providers)
- Local Printers (on-premise)

### Workflow Automation (2 integrations)
- Power Automate (certified connector)
- Azure Logic Apps (certified connector)

### Development & API (1 integration)
- REST API (DocumentsCorePack Connector API)

### External Data (1 integration)
- JSON Data Sources (external data integration into documents)

## Integration Types Available

- **Native Integrations:** Dynamics 365, Dataverse, SharePoint, Power Platform services
- **Certified Connectors:** Power Automate, Power Apps, Logic Apps (Microsoft-verified)
- **API Integrations:** REST API for custom integrations
- **Third-Party Integrations:** Adobe Sign, cloud print providers
- **Storage Integrations:** Azure Blob, SharePoint, on-premise file systems

## API & Developer Information

### DocumentsCorePack Connector API

**Base URL:** https://documentapi.mscrm-addons.com  
**API Documentation:** [https://short.mscrm-addons.com/serviceconfigmanual](https://short.mscrm-addons.com/serviceconfigmanual)  
**Swagger/OpenAPI:** https://documentapi.mscrm-addons.com/swagger/v1/swagger.json

**Authentication:** API Key (generated from DocumentsCorePack Service Configuration)

**Rate Limits:**
- 1200 API calls per connection per 60 seconds
- Applies to Power Automate, Power Apps, and Logic Apps connectors

**Available Endpoints:**
- Document generation (sync/async)
- DocumentJob status and result retrieval
- Template management
- Printer configuration
- E-signature workflows
- SharePoint operations
- Email operations

**Custom Connector Support:** Yes  
Organizations can create custom Power Automate/Power Apps connectors using the Swagger definition for specialized scenarios.

**Webhook Support:** No direct webhook support; use Power Automate triggers or polling mechanisms.

**SDK/Libraries:** No official SDK; REST API accessible from any HTTP-capable language/platform.

## Support & Documentation

- **API Documentation:** [https://short.mscrm-addons.com/serviceconfigmanual](https://short.mscrm-addons.com/serviceconfigmanual)
- **Connector Documentation:** [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/documentscorepackapi/)
- **Knowledge Base:** [https://support.mscrm-addons.com/](https://support.mscrm-addons.com/)
- **Support Email:** support@mscrm-addons.com
- **Support Hours:** 17/5 (17 hours, 5 days per week)
- **Training:** Video tutorials on YouTube channel
- **Community:** Partner network (700+ partners globally)

## Product Overview & Strategic Analysis

### Strengths

1. **Deep Microsoft Ecosystem Integration**  
   Official Microsoft Partner with certified solutions across Dynamics 365 and Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps, Power Pages, Copilot). This ensures compatibility, security, and long-term support aligned with Microsoft's roadmap.

2. **Proven Track Record & Scale**  
   5,500+ customers, 80,000+ daily users across 80+ countries with a network of 700+ partners demonstrates market validation, reliability, and global reach.

3. **Significant Cost Savings**  
   AttachmentExtractor delivers documented 90%+ reduction in Dataverse storage costs, potentially saving organizations thousands to tens of thousands annually on Microsoft capacity fees.

4. **No-Code Approach**  
   DocumentsCorePack's template designer empowers business users to create and modify document templates without developer involvement, reducing IT dependency and accelerating time-to-value.

5. **Flexible Deployment Options**  
   Offers both cloud subscription (SaaS) and on-premise perpetual licensing, accommodating diverse organizational requirements for data residency, compliance, and budgeting models.

6. **Comprehensive Power Platform Coverage**  
   Beyond Dynamics 365, integrations extend to Power Automate workflows, Power Apps interfaces, Power Pages portals, and Microsoft Copilot, maximizing automation and AI capabilities.

7. **Storage & Performance Optimization**  
   AttachmentExtractor maintains user experience while offloading data to cost-effective external storage, solving a critical pain point for organizations with high email volumes.

### Weaknesses

1. **Microsoft Ecosystem Lock-In**  
   Solutions are exclusively designed for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. Organizations using Salesforce, HubSpot, or other CRMs cannot leverage these tools, limiting market applicability.

2. **Per-User Licensing Costs**  
   Subscription model requires licenses for every user with write permissions, which can become expensive for large teams. Small organizations might find tiers insufficient while larger ones face escalating costs.

3. **Document Generation Caps**  
   Monthly document limits in subscription tiers (500-50,000) could constrain high-volume organizations, requiring upgrades or throttling workflows during peak periods.

4. **External Storage Setup Complexity**  
   AttachmentExtractor requires configuring SharePoint, Azure Blob Storage, or on-premise file systems, adding implementation overhead and potential points of failure.

5. **Limited Native CRM Features**  
   Focus on add-ons means reliance on Dynamics 365's core CRM functionality. Organizations seeking all-in-one platforms with built-in document automation might prefer integrated alternatives.

6. **Perpetual License Support Dependency**  
   On-premise licenses require annual Support & Maintenance renewals after Year 1, creating ongoing costs and potential disruption if support lapses.

### Use Cases

#### Ideal For

- **Dynamics 365 Customers Needing Document Automation:** Organizations using Dynamics 365 Sales, Service, or Marketing modules requiring contract generation, proposal automation, or compliance documentation without custom development.

- **Organizations Reducing Storage Costs:** Companies hitting Dataverse capacity limits or facing escalating Microsoft storage fees, particularly those with high email attachment volumes (thousands of emails monthly).

- **Businesses Seeking No-Code Solutions:** Teams wanting to empower business users to create/modify document templates without IT bottlenecks or expensive developer resources.

- **Microsoft-Certified Solution Seekers:** Enterprises with strict vendor requirements, security policies, or compliance needs that mandate Microsoft-certified partners and solutions.

- **Mid-Sized to Enterprise Firms:** Organizations with 50-600+ users needing scalable document automation, storage optimization, and productivity tools across sales, service, and marketing teams.

- **Companies Automating Complex Workflows:** Users leveraging Power Automate for multi-step processes (e.g., quote→approval→generation→signature→delivery) that integrate document generation into broader automation.

- **Global Organizations:** Businesses operating across multiple countries requiring multi-language templates, regional customization, and 17/5 support coverage.

#### Not Ideal For

- **Non-Microsoft CRM Users:** Organizations using Salesforce, HubSpot, Zoho, or other CRM platforms cannot use mscrm-addons products. Better served by platform-native tools (e.g., Conga for Salesforce).

- **Small Teams with Minimal Document Needs:** Startups or small businesses generating fewer than 100 documents monthly might find pricing excessive compared to simpler tools like Zapier + Google Docs.

- **Budget-Constrained Organizations:** Per-user licensing (€800-€9,800/year for DocumentsCorePack alone) may strain budgets, especially when combined with Dynamics 365 licensing costs.

- **Companies Requiring Multi-Platform Support:** Businesses needing document automation across multiple CRMs or systems (e.g., Dynamics + Salesforce hybrid environments) should explore platform-agnostic solutions like Nintex or Conga Composer.

- **Organizations Without External Storage:** Teams unable or unwilling to set up SharePoint, Azure Blob Storage, or on-premise file systems cannot leverage AttachmentExtractor's cost-saving benefits.

- **Highly Customized Document Needs:** Companies requiring extensive custom development, complex conditional logic beyond template capabilities, or integration with specialized third-party systems might need bespoke development.

- **Cost-Sensitive High-Volume Users:** Organizations generating 100,000+ documents monthly may find tiered subscription costs prohibitive and should evaluate custom enterprise pricing or alternative solutions.

### Key Differentiators

1. **Official Microsoft Partner with Certified Solutions**  
   Unlike third-party tools, mscrm-addons holds Microsoft Partner status with AppSource-verified solutions, ensuring security reviews, compatibility testing, and alignment with Microsoft's product roadmap.

2. **AttachmentExtractor's Unique Cost-Saving Approach**  
   Few competitors offer a dedicated solution for transparently moving Dataverse attachments to external storage while maintaining unchanged user experience. This addresses a critical pain point unique to Dynamics 365 users.

3. **Comprehensive Power Platform Integration**  
   Deep integration across Dynamics 365, Power Automate, Power Apps, Power Pages, and Copilot provides seamless automation possibilities that platform-agnostic tools cannot match within the Microsoft ecosystem.

4. **No-Code Template Designer for Business Users**  
   DocumentsCorePack's Word-based template designer empowers non-technical users to create complex documents with conditional logic, field mapping, and branding—reducing IT dependency compared to code-heavy alternatives.

5. **Dual Deployment Model (Cloud + On-Premise)**  
   Offering both subscription SaaS and perpetual on-premise licensing accommodates diverse organizational requirements for data residency, compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and capital vs. operational expense budgeting.

6. **Proven Global Scale & Longevity**  
   With 5,500+ customers, 80,000+ daily users, and 700+ partners across 80 countries, mscrm-addons demonstrates market validation and staying power—reducing vendor risk compared to newer or smaller competitors.

7. **Specialized Productivity Add-Ons (PowerSearch, SmartBar, ActivityTools)**  
   Beyond document automation, mscrm-addons offers complementary productivity tools addressing navigation, search, and activity management pain points often overlooked by document-focused competitors.

### Alternatives & Comparisons

#### 1. **Conga Composer** (formerly Conga Merge)

**Positioning:** Multi-platform document automation leader (Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP)

**Comparison:**
- **Broader Platform Support:** Conga supports Salesforce, Dynamics 365, and other CRMs; mscrm-addons is Microsoft-only
- **Higher Pricing:** Conga typically costs more ($40-100+ per user/month) vs. mscrm-addons (€7-16/user/month for DocumentsCorePack)
- **More Complex Setup:** Conga's enterprise features require steeper learning curve; mscrm-addons emphasizes simplicity
- **Stronger Contract Lifecycle Management:** Conga Contracts adds CLM capabilities; mscrm-addons focuses on generation
- **Best For:** Multi-CRM environments, Salesforce-heavy users, organizations needing CLM integration
- **Choose mscrm-addons If:** You're exclusively in the Microsoft ecosystem and want simpler, lower-cost document automation

#### 2. **DocuSign Gen (formerly SpringCM)** for Salesforce

**Positioning:** Document generation with electronic signature integration for Salesforce

**Comparison:**
- **Salesforce-Focused:** Native Salesforce tool; no Dynamics 365 support
- **Integrated E-Signature:** Tightly coupled with DocuSign workflows; mscrm-addons supports e-sig but isn't DocuSign-native
- **Contract Management:** Includes repository and version control; mscrm-addons is generation-focused
- **Higher Cost:** Often bundled with DocuSign CLM (expensive); mscrm-addons more affordable
- **Best For:** Salesforce users needing document generation + signature + CLM in one platform
- **Choose mscrm-addons If:** You use Dynamics 365, want standalone document automation without CLM overhead

#### 3. **Nintex DocGen** (formerly Drawloop)

**Positioning:** Multi-platform document automation (Salesforce, Dynamics 365, SharePoint)

**Comparison:**
- **Multi-Platform Support:** Supports Salesforce and Dynamics 365; broader than mscrm-addons' Microsoft focus
- **Nintex Workflow Integration:** Part of larger Nintex automation suite; mscrm-addons focuses on Power Platform
- **Complex Licensing:** Nintex bundles products; pricing less transparent than mscrm-addons' tiered model
- **Strong SharePoint Integration:** Nintex excels in SharePoint workflows; mscrm-addons integrates but isn't SharePoint-centric
- **Best For:** Organizations using multiple CRMs or requiring Salesforce + Dynamics 365 coverage
- **Choose mscrm-addons If:** You're all-in on Microsoft, want simpler pricing, need AttachmentExtractor's cost savings

#### 4. **Native Dynamics 365 Document Generation** (Out-of-the-Box)

**Positioning:** Microsoft's built-in Word template functionality in Dynamics 365

**Comparison:**
- **Free (Included):** No additional license cost; mscrm-addons requires subscription/perpetual license
- **Limited Automation:** Basic template merge; lacks workflow automation, batch generation, advanced features
- **No Storage Optimization:** No AttachmentExtractor equivalent for cost reduction
- **Manual Processes:** Requires manual template application; mscrm-addons automates via Power Automate
- **Best For:** Small teams with simple, infrequent document needs and tight budgets
- **Choose mscrm-addons If:** You need automation, batch generation, complex templates, or storage cost reduction

#### 5. **Custom Power Automate Workflows** (DIY Approach)

**Positioning:** Building document generation using Power Automate connectors and custom code

**Comparison:**
- **Lower Licensing Cost:** No additional per-user fees beyond Power Automate licenses
- **High Development Cost:** Requires developer time to build/maintain; mscrm-addons is pre-built
- **Flexibility:** Complete control over logic and integrations; mscrm-addons has guardrails
- **Maintenance Burden:** Updates, bug fixes, enhancements require ongoing dev resources
- **Best For:** Organizations with in-house dev teams, highly unique requirements, or budget for custom work
- **Choose mscrm-addons If:** You want out-of-the-box functionality, faster time-to-value, vendor support

### Summary Recommendation

**Choose mscrm-addons if:**
- You're committed to the Microsoft Dynamics 365 & Power Platform ecosystem
- Storage costs are a pain point (AttachmentExtractor's 90% savings is compelling)
- You value no-code template design for business user empowerment
- You need Microsoft-certified solutions for compliance/security requirements
- Mid-sized to enterprise scale (50-600+ users) with moderate-to-high document volumes

**Explore Alternatives if:**
- You use multiple CRMs (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.) or plan to switch platforms
- Budget is extremely constrained and native Dynamics 365 features suffice
- You require advanced CLM, contract repositories, or legal workflow features
- Document volumes are minimal (<100/month) and don't justify add-on costs
- You have in-house dev resources and prefer custom-built solutions
